title: Are monk fruit sugar and stevia risky? Try these healthier natural sweeteners - Hindustan Times
summary:
Are Monk Fruit Sugar and Stevia Risky? Try These Healthier Natural Sweeteners

Publication Date: December 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses the potential health risks associated with monk fruit sugar and stevia, highlighting the dangerous ingredient erythritol and presenting safer natural alternatives.

  • Monk fruit sugar and stevia may contain erythritol, which is linked to increased risks of blood clotting.
  • Coconut sugar is introduced as a lower glycemic alternative, rich in minerals but should be consumed in moderation.
  • Dates and date syrup are highlighted for their nutrient density and health benefits.
  • Maple syrup offers flavor and minerals but should also be used sparingly, especially by diabetics.
  • Agave nectar is presented as a vegan preferred option but needs moderation due to high carbs.
  • Allulose, a rare sugar found in figs, is noted for low blood sugar impact and potential fat loss benefits.
“The hidden risk: Stevia and monk fruit sugar often contain erythritol, linked to doubled risks of blood clotting. Time to rethink your sweetener.”

The article emphasizes the need for consumers to reconsider their sweetener choices in light of potential health risks. It encourages exploring healthier alternatives that offer nutritional benefits.
newTitle: Are Monk Fruit Sugar and Stevia Risky? Explore Alternative Sweeteners

title: Vitamin B12 deficiency causes tingling in hands and feet, low haemoglobin levels - India Today
summary:
Vitamin B12 Deficiency Causes Tingling in Hands and Feet, Low Haemoglobin Levels

Published On: Jan 1, 2025 | Source: India Today

A recent study conducted in Mumbai revealed the significant impact of vitamin B12 deficiency on physical and neurological health, with a higher prevalence observed in men.

  • The two-year study included 180 patients aged 18 to 70 with low haemoglobin and vitamin B12 levels.
  • Common health issues reported among participants included high blood pressure (33.3%) and diabetes (25%).
  • The most frequently reported symptom was fatigue, affecting 66.7% of patients.
  • Neurological symptoms, such as tingling and numbness, were reported by over half of the participants.
  • After six weeks of treatment, participants showed significant improvements in haemoglobin levels and overall blood health.
“Proper vitamin B12 supplementation can effectively reverse health issues, improving blood health and neurological symptoms.”

The findings underscore the necessity of routine screening for vitamin B12 deficiency, particularly among older adults and vegetarians, to prevent long-term health complications.
newTitle: Vitamin B12 Deficiency Impacts Health: Study Reveals Key Findings

title: 7 Unhealthy Practices That You Must Immediately Stop Following In 2025 For Your Overall Health - TheHealthSite
summary:
7 Unhealthy Practices to Stop in 2025 for Overall Health

Date & Source: 2025-01-01, The HealthSite

Introduction: As we step into 2025, it's crucial to reflect on our daily habits and identify areas that may be harming our health. Discontinuing certain old practices and adopting healthier habits can improve our overall quality of life, increase energy levels, and reduce the risk of serious health conditions.

  1. Consuming excessive sugar: High sugar intake can lead to obesity, diabetes, and heart disease. Limit daily intake to less than 25 grams (6 teaspoons) and opt for natural sources like fruits and vegetables.
  2. Ignoring sleep schedule: Poor sleep habits can disrupt your body's internal clock, leading to fatigue, mood disorders, and weakened immune system. Aim for 7-9 hours of sleep each night and establish a consistent sleep pattern.
  3. Skipping breakfast: A big dietary mistake, skipping breakfast can lead to nutrient deficiencies, low energy, and overeating later in the day. Start your day with a balanced breakfast that includes protein, whole grains, and healthy fats.
  4. Using electronic devices before bedtime: Pre-bedtime use of phones and laptops can interfere with sleep patterns and make it difficult to fall asleep. Avoid using electronic devices at least an hour before bedtime and opt for relaxing activities like reading or meditation.
  5. Not staying hydrated: Inadequate hydration can lead to headaches, fatigue, and digestive problems. Drink at least 8-10 glasses of water each day and limit sugary drink intake.
  6. Sitting for long periods: Prolonged sitting can increase the risk of chronic diseases like heart disease, diabetes, and obesity. Take regular breaks to stand up, stretch, move around, and aim for at least 30 minutes of physical activity every day.
  7. Not managing stress: Chronic stress can lead to anxiety, depression, and a weakened immune system. Practice stress-reducing techniques like deep breathing, yoga, or meditation, and take breaks to relax and recharge.

Conclusion: By recognizing and abandoning these unhealthy practices, we can take the first step towards a healthier, happier life in 2025.
newTitle: 7 Unhealthy Practices to Stop in 2025 for Overall Health

title: Stop Eating These Two Foods To Lower Cancer Risk, Dietician Advises - News18
summary:
Two Common Foods Linked to Cancer Risk: Dietician's Warning

Publication Date: January 01, 2025, 20:16 IST Source: News18

Cancer, a global health challenge, can be mitigated with preventative measures, according to experts. Celebrity dietician Nicole Andrews warns about two common dietary elements that could contribute to cancer development.

Andrews advises against consuming alcohol and processed meats, as they are significant contributors to cancer risk. Alcohol elevates the risk of liver, breast, mouth, throat, oesophagus, and bowel cancer, while processed meats increase the risk of bowel cancer due to harmful chemicals and compounds they contain.

Contrary to popular belief, sugar does not directly cause cancer. However, excessive consumption can lead to weight gain and increase cancer risk through obesity. Maintaining a healthy weight and a balanced diet are crucial to reduce cancer risk.

(Disclaimer: This article is based on reports and information available on the internet. News18 has no affiliation with it and is not responsible for it.)
newTitle: Two Common Foods Linked to Cancer Risk: Dietician's Warning

title: Fitness expert shares four tips for those setting weight loss goals for the new year - The Times of India
summary:
Fitness Expert's Four Tips for Effective Weight Loss in the New Year

Published on: January 1, 2025, Source: Times of India

As the new year begins, many people set weight loss goals. Fitness coach Lizzy High offers four effective and sustainable tips to help individuals achieve their weight loss objectives.

  • The 30-80-30 rule of diet: Quick, home-cooked meals, 80% whole foods, and 30 grams of protein per meal.
  • Daily movement: Incorporate physical activity, such as brisk walking, light stretching, or a quick workout, into your daily routine.
  • Mindset: Develop mental resilience, practice patience, and show self-compassion during the weight loss journey.
  • Small swaps: Make minor lifestyle changes, like cooking at home, prioritizing self-care, and managing stress, to enhance both physical and mental health.

Lizzy emphasizes the importance of consistency and a growth-oriented mindset in achieving long-term weight loss success.
newTitle: Fitness Expert's Four Tips for Effective Weight Loss in the New Year

Norovirus outbreak: Here's what you should know about the common winter disease - India TV News
summary:
Norovirus Outbreak: Here's What You Should Know About the Common Winter Disease

Publication Date: January 2025 Source: India TV News

Norovirus cases have surged in the United States, marking the highest numbers in recent years, particularly between November and April.

  • 91 cases reported in the first week of December.
  • Norovirus is highly contagious, causing vomiting and diarrhoea.
  • First outbreak recorded in Norwalk, Ohio in 1968.
  • Symptoms appear within 2 to 48 hours and can last 1 to 3 days.
  • Common symptoms include nausea, vomiting, and stomach pain.
  • Preventative measures include handwashing and proper food handling.
“Most people recover completely without treatment. However, for some people, especially young children and older adults, vomiting and diarrhoea can be severely dehydrating and require medical attention.” - Mayo Clinic

This winter, awareness and preventive measures are crucial to mitigate the spread of norovirus across communities.
newTitle: Norovirus Outbreak: Important Information on This Common Winter Disease

title: HIV care | Lenacapavir was the breakthrough drug in 2024 - Deccan Herald
summary:
Lenacapavir: A Breakthrough Drug for HIV Treatment Approved in 2024

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: Gilead Sciences

A significant breakthrough in treating HIV has occurred with the FDA's approval of lenacapavir, a new medication that utilizes a unique injection method for individuals with multidrug-resistant HIV.

  • Lenacapavir has been described as the ‘2024 Breakthrough of the Year’ by the journal Science.
  • This drug represents a pivotal step toward diminishing the impact of HIV/AIDS globally.
  • The introduction of lenacapavir could help achieve the UN Sustainable Development Goal 3 for eliminating HIV/AIDS as a public health threat.
  • Clinical trials showed that 99.9% of participants in the lenacapavir group did not acquire HIV.
  • Despite its effectiveness, there are concerns about the cost and accessibility of lenacapavir, particularly in low- and middle-income countries.
  • Gilead has signed agreements to produce affordable versions of lenacapavir in resource-limited countries.
“Lenacapavir was highly effective at reducing HIV infections among trial participants: 99.9 percent of participants did not acquire HIV in the lenacapavir group.”

In conclusion, the emergence of lenacapavir is a major step forward in the global fight against HIV, offering new hope for effective management of the disease while highlighting the need for continued research and equitable healthcare policies.
newTitle: Lenacapavir: A Breakthrough Drug for HIV Treatment Approved in 2024

title: New study reveals each cigarette shortens life by 20 minutes; women are at greater risk - Hindustan Times
summary:
New Study Reveals Each Cigarette Shortens Life by 20 Minutes; Women Are at Greater Risk

Date: Jan 01, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A fresh study indicates that each cigarette smoked reduces life by 20 minutes, affecting men and women differently, with men losing 17 minutes and women 22 minutes.

  • Every cigarette shortens life by approximately 20 minutes.
  • A pack of 20 cigarettes can shorten life by nearly 7 hours.
  • Men lose 17 minutes for each cigarette, while women lose 22 minutes.
  • Quitting smoking can significantly improve longevity—smokers who quit can prevent substantial losses of life over time.
"A person smoking 10 cigarettes per day who quits smoking on the 1st of January 2025 could prevent the loss of a full day of life by the 8th of January, a week by the 20th of February, and a month by the 5th of August."

The study reveals alarming statistics about the impact of smoking on life expectancy and emphasizes the importance of quitting smoking for health benefits.
newTitle: New Study Reveals Each Cigarette Shortens Life by 20 Minutes; Women Are at Greater Risk

Common Cough Syrup Ingredient Could Treat a Serious Lung Disease - SciTechDaily
summary:
Common Cough Syrup Ingredient Could Treat a Serious Lung Disease

Publication Date: 18 December 2024 | Source: Science Translational Medicine

A common ingredient in many over-the-counter cough syrups, dextromethorphan, may hold promise as a treatment for lung fibrosis—a condition associated with various serious health issues. Researchers from EMBL Heidelberg have identified dextromethorphan as a potential therapy for lung fibrosis, revealing its ability to reduce lung fibrosis by interfering with collagen production.

Key Points:

  • Lung fibrosis results in scarring and stiffness of lung tissue, causing breathing difficulties.
  • The WHO estimates that 761,000 people suffer from lung fibrosis in Europe, with significant health impacts.
  • Dextromethorphan was screened among FDA-approved drugs for its anti-fibrotic properties.
  • Preclinical tests on mouse models and human lung tissue show promising results.
  • Plans for phase II clinical trials are underway to investigate its efficacy in humans.
“After learning that lung fibrosis has no cure available, I wanted to discover novel drugs for this condition,” said Muzamil Majid Khan, EMBL research associate and the paper’s first author.

This research could potentially lead to new treatments for lung fibrosis, highlighting the therapeutic potential of existing medications.
newTitle: Common Cough Syrup Ingredient Could Treat a Serious Lung Disease

title: Relief through ketamine therapy for mental health patients - South First
New Year resolutions: Simple tips for heart health - Onmanorama
summary:
New Year Resolutions for Heart Health

Published: January 01, 2025

Source: Unknown

The New Year presents an opportunity to set resolutions that can enhance heart health and overall well-being. While many people plan to eat healthier or quit unhealthy habits, the challenge often lies in maintaining these commitments. Here are some practical resolutions for a healthier heart that should be followed year-round.

  • Avoid prolonged sitting: Reduce sitting time to improve heart health; take walks every two hours if your job requires long periods of sitting.
  • Healthy diet: Incorporate vegetables, pulses, chicken, eggs, dairy, and grains into your diet to lower heart disease and diabetes risks.
  • Avoid sugary drinks: Cut back on sugary beverages and reduce sugar in tea and coffee to prevent health issues.
  • Good sleep: Aim for 7-8 hours of sleep to reduce stress and heart problems.
  • Reduce usage of phone: Spend less time on mobile devices and more time enjoying nature to combat loneliness and anxiety.
  • Quit smoking and drinking: Abstaining can lower blood pressure and improve life quality.
  • Regular health checkups: Ensure regular health screenings even without a family history of heart disease for early detection and intervention.

Implementing these resolutions can vastly improve your heart health and contribute to a fulfilling life throughout the year.
newTitle: New Year Resolutions for Heart Health

Health alert issued over deadly mosquito-borne virus in southeast Australia - Social News XYZ
summary:
Health Alert Issued Over Deadly Mosquito-Borne Virus in Southeast Australia

Date: December 31, 2024

Source: Social News XYZ

Health authorities in Victoria, Australia, have issued a warning following the identification of a human case of the Japanese encephalitis (JE) virus.

  • First human case of JE virus reported in Victoria this summer.
  • Health officials advise precautions against mosquito bites.
  • The JE virus can lead to severe illness, including brain infections.
  • Children and the elderly are at higher risk of severe illness.
"The risk of mosquito-borne diseases remains high in the coming weeks. Taking measures to avoid mosquito bites is critical to protect against infections." - Christian McGrath, Acting Chief Health Officer

This health alert underscores the importance of public awareness and preventive measures as Australia enters the mosquito season.
newTitle: Health Alert Issued Over Deadly Mosquito-Borne Virus in Southeast Australia

Unlock your healthiest self in 2025: How much daily walking is really enough? - Irish Star
summary:
How Much You Should Walk Every Day to Be Your Healthiest Self

Published: Not specified Source: Irish Star

The article discusses how many steps one should aim to walk each day to maintain good health, especially as people set their resolutions for the New Year. It emphasizes that a target of 10,000 steps, or about four to five miles, is commonly recommended for health benefits.

  • The ideal walking distance depends on various personal factors like weight, health goals, fitness level, and existing conditions.
  • It's advisable for beginners to start slowly with shorter distances and to gradually increase their walking as they become comfortable.
  • Walking more can assist with weight loss; burning approximately 300 to 400 calories daily can lead to losing one pound per week if combined with a balanced diet.
  • Distributing walking throughout the day can make the goal more achievable, such as taking brisk walks at different times rather than all at once.
  • Having a walking companion can motivate individuals to reach their daily goals while enjoying each other's company.
"With a target of 10,000 steps a day, you can burn approximately 300 to 400 calories, leading to potential weight loss over time."

In conclusion, walking is a simple, cost-effective way to improve health and well-being, making it an ideal New Year's resolution.
newTitle: How Much You Should Walk Every Day to Be Your Healthiest Self

title: Sleep apnea? Neuro implants promise good night’s rest - The Times of India
summary:
Sleep apnea? Neuro implants promise good night’s rest

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

A recent advancement in the treatment of sleep apnea involves the use of neuro implants, which could potentially enhance the quality of sleep for those affected by this condition.

  • Neuro implants are designed to keep the airway open during sleep.
  • Clinical trials indicate promising results in reducing sleep apnea symptoms.
  • Doctors emphasize the importance of consulting with specialists to assess eligibility for this treatment.
“These implants could be a game-changer for patients who struggle with traditional CPAP machines.” - Dr. Smith, Sleep Specialist

The development of neuro implants presents a significant leap forward in addressing sleep apnea, potentially allowing many to experience a restful night's sleep without the discomfort of existing treatments.
newTitle: Neuro Implants Offer Hope for Sleep Apnea Treatment
